description: A comforting and easy-to-make Dal Tadka served over fluffy rice, perfect for a nutritious meal.
instructions: Rinse the rice and dal thoroughly.
In a pot, combine the rinsed rice, dal, 1 tablespoon of cooking oil, and 2 cups of water. Add half of the basic_spices.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat, cover, and simmer for about 20-25 minutes, or until the rice and dal are cooked and tender. Stir occasionally.
While the rice and dal are cooking, heat the remaining 1 tablespoon of cooking oil in a small pan over medium heat.
Add the remaining basic_spices to the hot oil and let them splutter for a few seconds to create a 'tadka'. Be careful not to burn them.
Pour the tadka over the cooked rice and dal mixture. Stir gently to combine.
Serve the Dal Tadka rice in a bowl. Top with a dollop of curd and sprinkle with roasted chana for added texture and flavor.
tips: Adjust the amount of basic_spices according to your preference for spiciness.
Ensure the tadka is not burnt, as it can make the dish bitter.
The roasted chana adds a nice crunch; you can lightly crush them before adding if desired.
